attributes.action: give all Ex Gurkha soldiers equal pension regardless of when they retired.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Gurkhas are only asking for equal treatment as promised in the Tri Partite Agreement. If the pre-1997 ex-servicemen are given pensions equal to British soldiers and Gurkhas soldiers serving after 1997, they will have no need to migrate to the UK in search of secondary employment.  They will happily retire in Nepal.  Priority needs to be given to the 18,000 retired Gurkhas who do not qualify for Army pensions, roughly 10,000 of whom survive on Welfare Pensions of just £29 per month, and 8,000 who receive no income whatsoever, because there is no state pension in Nepal.  Many of these elderly men are living in destitution.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to give all Ex Gurkha soldiers equal pension regardless of when they retired.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
